intro: Tragopyrum laetevirens, commonly known as the yellow goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, arranged in dense, panicle-like clusters. Tragopyrum laetevirens is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partially shaded conditions.
